demographics.name: James Wilson
demographics.advanceDirectives: Durable Power of Attorney for Healthcare: Sarah Wilson
demographics.supportServices: Pelvic Floor PT Referral (post-RT), Urology Nurse Coordinator, Prostate Cancer Support Group info.

diagnosis.vascularInvolvement: No definite lymphovascular invasion identified on biopsy.
diagnosis.pathologicStage: pT2c N0 M0 (based on biopsy, pending surgery if applicable, currently clinical stage cT2c N0 M0)
diagnosis.clinicalStage: cT2c N0 M0 (based on DRE, PSA, MRI)
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Mild urinary frequency, nocturia x2. Found on screening PSA/DRE.
pathologyFindings: Total of 2/12 cores positive for adenocarcinoma.
diagnosis.priorProcedures: None related to cancer treatment prior to ADT/RT.
diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Started Androgen Deprivation Therapy (ADT - Leuprolide) on 02/01/2025.

treatmentPlan.intent: Definitive (Curative) - Curative intent for localized high-risk prostate adenocarcinoma.
treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with Concurrent Androgen Deprivation Therapy (ADT)
treatmentPlan.rtRxDetails: 79.2 Gy / 44 fx (1.8 Gy/fx), delivered once daily, 5 days per week.
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing Prostate gland, bilateral proximal Seminal Vesicles with a 7mm uniform margin, excluding posterior rectum and inferior bladder. GTV defined by MRI/CT fusion.
treatmentPlan.techniqueSummary: Volumetric Modulated Arc Therapy (VMAT) - Two full arcs (CW and CCW) to optimize dose distribution and spare surrounding organs.
treatmentPlan.detailedConcurrentChemo: Leuprolide injection (22.5 mg - 3-month depot) started 02/01/2025 (2 months prior to RT start). Planned duration: 18-24 months total. Managed by Urology.
medications: Tamsulosin 0.4mg daily (for BPH symptoms, continue during RT)
Loperamide PRN Diarrhea (as needed for bowel looseness)
Oxybutynin PRN Urinary Frequency/Urgency (as needed for bladder spasms)
therapistAlerts: Verify fiducial markers daily with IGRT.
Patient may experience fatigue from RT and ADT.
Monitor for acute GU/GI toxicity (frequency, urgency, diarrhea, rectal pain).

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in VacLok bag with ankle immobilization. Custom leg roll for comfort. Full bladder / empty rectum protocol followed strictly. Oral contrast (Omnipaque) given 1 hour prior to scan for small bowel delineation. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.immobilization: VacLok bag (pelvic region), ankle immobilization cushion, custom leg roll.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals). Small anterior tattoo for visual alignment.
ctSimulation.contrastUsed: IV Contrast (Ultravist 370) to visualize vasculature and nodal regions. Oral contrast (Omnipaque) for bowel visualization.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired after confirming full bladder and empty rectum. Fiducial markers well visualized within the prostate. Scan fused with diagnostic MRI Pelvis (01/20/2025) for comprehensive target and OAR delineation. Isocenter placed to centralize PTV.

dosimetry.planStatus: Final - Approved by Dr. Maria Garcia
dosimetry.gantryAngles: Arc 1: 181° CW to 179°; Arc 2: 179° CCW to 181°
dosimetry.isoCoords: L0.0, L+1.0, V-8.0 (relative to scanner coordinates)
dosimetry.constraints: Rectum V70Gy < 20%; Bladder V75Gy < 15%; Femoral Head Max < 50 Gy; Small Bowel Dmax < 54 Gy; Rectal Dmax < 79.2 Gy (point dose)
dosimetry.planNotes: Definitive VMAT plan for localized prostate adenocarcinoma. Daily IGRT to fiducial markers is mandatory for accurate positioning. Patient-specific QA performed and passed. Plan reviewed and signed by Physics and Physician.

igrtProtocol.type: kV pair (Orthogonal) or CBCT for fiducial matching
igrtProtocol.alignment: Match to implanted fiducial markers in prostate. Verify bladder/rectum filling consistency.

qaChecks.result: Pass - No issues identified. Tolerances maintained.

fractions.fieldsAndMUs: Arc 1 (410 MU), Arc 2 (405 MU) - Total: 815 MU
fractions.immobilizationDevicesChecked: VacLok bag, ankle immobilization, leg roll
fractions.organTargetChecks: kV imaging to fiducials, good match. Bladder full, rectum empty per protocol.
fractions.instructionsGiven: Reinforced daily prep, report any new symptoms.
fractions.dailyNotes: First fraction delivered smoothly. Patient comfortable. Bladder/rectum protocol explained again.

fractions.fieldsAndMUs: Arc 1 (410 MU), Arc 2 (405 MU) - Total: 815 MU
fractions.immobilizationDevicesChecked: VacLok bag, ankle immobilization, leg roll
fractions.setupAdjustments: V: 0.2cm, L: -0.1cm, S: 0.1cm (based on fiducial match)
fractions.organTargetChecks: kV imaging to fiducials, shifts applied. Bladder adequate, small amount of gas in rectum.
fractions.igrtVerificationNotes: Minor shifts to align fiducials. Rectal gas noted, not impacting target coverage based on imaging.
fractions.generalSideEffects: Mild fatigue, occasional mild urinary frequency.
fractions.siteSpecificSideEffects: Increased urinary frequency, managed with Tamsulosin.
fractions.patientConcerns: Asking about dietary recommendations for bowel gas.
fractions.instructionsGiven: Reviewed diet for gas reduction (avoiding gassy foods). Continue Tamsulosin.
fractions.dailyNotes: Patient cooperative. Discussed diet. Shifts applied for fiducials.

fractions.fieldsAndMUs: Arc 1 (410 MU), Arc 2 (405 MU) - Total: 815 MU
fractions.immobilizationDevicesChecked: VacLok bag, ankle immobilization, leg roll
fractions.organTargetChecks: Daily CBCT match to fiducial markers. Shifts applied as needed. Good bladder/rectum filling today. Rectal volume appears consistent.
fractions.igrtVerificationNotes: Minor shifts based on CBCT and fiducial match. Physician review and approval.
fractions.generalSideEffects: Mild increase in urinary frequency noted. Mild fatigue ongoing.
fractions.siteSpecificSideEffects: Mild increase in urinary frequency, occasional mild rectal pressure.
fractions.patientConcerns: Asking about next ADT injection date.
fractions.instructionsGiven: Next ADT injection date confirmed with Urology. Continue current symptom management.
fractions.dailyNotes: Patient managing ADT side effects (mild hot flashes). Continue to review bowel/bladder management. CBCT review by MD.

reportDetails.finalDiagnosis: PROSTATE, TRUS-GUIDED BIOPSY: ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON PATTERN 4+3=7, GRADE GROUP 3. Present in 2/12 cores. Largest single focus 5mm.
reportDetails.microscopicDescription: The prostate biopsy cores show foci of adenocarcinoma with predominant Gleason pattern 4 and a lesser component of Gleason pattern 3. There is cribriform architecture noted. No perineural invasion or lymphovascular invasion identified. Benign prostatic tissue is also present.
reportDetails.comment: The biopsy findings indicate clinically significant prostate cancer.

imagingAndReports.summary: Confirms T2c disease, capsule bulging bilaterally, no definite ECE. Seminal vesicles appear clear. PI-RADS 4 lesion.

reportDetails.findings: Large, ill-defined lesion in the peripheral zone of the prostate, involving bilateral lobes (anterior/midgland). Appears confined to prostate capsule but with bulging contour. No definite extraprostatic extension (EPE) or seminal vesicle invasion (SVI). No suspicious lymphadenopathy. Osseous structures unremarkable.
reportDetails.impression: PI-RADS 4 lesion, highly suspicious for clinically significant prostate cancer. Correlates with known biopsy-proven adenocarcinoma.

imagingAndReports.summary: No evidence of osseous metastatic disease. Benign degenerative changes.

reportDetails.findings: Symmetrical tracer uptake throughout the skeleton. No focal areas of increased uptake suspicious for metastatic disease. Mild degenerative changes noted in lumbar spine and hips, consistent with age.
reportDetails.impression: Negative for osseous metastatic disease. Physiologic/degenerative changes.

imagingAndReports.type: Urology Procedure Note - Fiducial Marker Placement
imagingAndReports.summary: Placement of 3 gold fiducial markers in prostate under TRUS guidance.

reportDetails.indication: Planned definitive radiation therapy for prostate adenocarcinoma.
reportDetails.findings: Prostate gland well visualized. 3 gold fiducial markers (1.0 x 3.0mm) successfully deployed into the prostate gland (apex, mid, base) under direct TRUS visualization.
reportDetails.instructions: Patient advised of potential mild discomfort and hematuria. Given post-procedure instructions.

imagingAndReports.summary: CT acquired with full bladder/empty rectum protocol. Fiducials visualized for planning.

reportDetails.setup: Supine, VacLok, Leg roll. Bladder full (400cc), rectum empty (checked with digital rectal exam). Oral contrast administered.
reportDetails.findings: Prostate gland and fiducial markers clearly visible. Bladder distention adequate and consistent. Rectum appears relatively empty of gas/stool. Scan covers planned treatment volume.
reportDetails.impression: Adequate CT simulation for prostate VMAT planning with fiducial guidance.

labResults.notes: Confirms castration level achieved with ADT.
During RT, significant drop post-ADT/initial RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Charles Brown (Urology)
progressNotes.summary: Pt referred for elevated PSA. Biopsy confirms Gleason 7 (4+3) AdenoCa. Staging T2c N0 M0. Discussed treatment options (Surgery vs RT+ADT). Given age/risk group, pt prefers RT+ADT. Plan to start Leuprolide injection, place fiducials, refer to Rad Onc.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Maria Garcia (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ favorable high-risk prostate ca, started on ADT. Plan for definitive EBRT via VMAT to prostate/SVs to 79.2Gy/44fx. Discussed procedure, fiducials/IGRT, bowel/bladder prep, potential side effects (GU/GI toxicity acute & late, ED risk, fatigue). Pt agrees. CT sim scheduled after fiducial placement. Next ADT injection due in 3 months.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Charles Brown (Urology)
progressNotes.summary: Successful placement of 3 gold fiducial markers into prostate via TRUS guidance. No complications. Mild hematuria expected for 24-48hrs. Patient tolerating well.

progressNotes.author: Physics/Dosimetry
progressNotes.summary: VMAT plan completed, meets dose constraints for rectum, bladder, femoral heads. Plan approved by Dr. Garcia. Ready for treatment start 03/17/2025. Daily CBCT/kV to fiducials for IGRT. Weekly physics chart check initiated.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Maria Garcia (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 5/44 fx. Reports mild increase in urinary frequency (Grade 1 GU), minimal rectal discomfort (Grade 0-1 GI). Tolerating ADT side effects (mild hot flashes) well. Setup/IGRT consistent. PSA decreased to 0.5. Continue RT. Reaffirmed bladder/rectum prep instructions. Encouraged hydration.

progressNotes.author: Radiation Therapist
progressNotes.summary: Fraction 10/44. Patient reports continued mild urinary frequency. Bladder scanned and full. Rectum appears empty. Fiducial match within tolerance, minor shifts applied. Patient cooperative. No acute skin reaction noted.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Definitive (curative) treatment for localized high-risk prostate cancer. Explain role of ADT in conjunction with RT. Discuss importance of long-term follow-up for PSA monitoring.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute (during RT): Increased urinary frequency/urgency, painful urination (dysuria), rectal discomfort, diarrhea (Grade 1-2 expected). Fatigue. Late (months-years post-RT): Rectal bleeding (proctitis), urinary incontinence, erectile dysfunction (ED). ADT side effects: hot flashes, fatigue, decreased libido, potential for bone density loss.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Crucial: Daily full bladder/empty rectum protocol. Use of fiducial markers for precise targeting and minimizing exposure to healthy tissue. Report any severe or worsening symptoms (e.g., fever, severe pain, inability to urinate).
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Adhere to daily bowel/bladder preparation. Attend all daily RT sessions. Continue ADT as prescribed by Urology. Report all side effects promptly. Maintain hydration and balanced diet. Engage in light exercise as tolerated.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Continue Tamsulosin as prescribed. Instructions for PRN Loperamide/Oxybutynin as needed. Emphasize importance of ADT compliance for treatment efficacy. Reviewed interactions with OTC medications/supplements. Provided contact numbers for nurse/physician for urgent concerns.

scheduling.notes: Decision for RT+ADT. Leuprolide order placed.
Detailed discussion of RT plan and side effects. Agreed to proceed.
Full bladder/empty rectum protocol followed. Scanned with fiducials.
Reviewed acute side effects. PSA 0.5. Stable.

cptCharges.description: Placement of interstitial device(s) for radiation therapy guidance (e.g., fiducial markers), prostate
Therapeutic radiology simulation-aided field setting, complex (Pelvis for IMRT/VMAT)
IMRT planning (includes target/OAR contouring, dose calculation)
Image Guided RT (IGRT - CBCT/kV for fiducials), daily
Office or other outpatient visit, established patient
